definition: to mark down (the price of goods)/to sell off cheap
to throw/to fling/to swing/to leave behind/to throw off/to dump (sb)
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
clearance sale/fire sale

sentences.english: An example is coupons or a sale.
sentences.chinese: 一个例子是折价券或大甩卖。

sentences.english: But I'm here because Las Vegas is on sale.
sentences.chinese: 但是我在这儿了，因为维加斯正在大甩卖。

sentences.english: Beijing Mall is having a big sale this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的，这个周末北京商厦大甩卖，你要去吗？

sentences.english: Our weekend-long garage sale took care of most everything else.
sentences.chinese: 我们的周末车库甩卖处理大部分其他物品。

sentences.english: Nevertheless even if is reduction sale, foolish a when girl also has him.
sentences.chinese: 不过即便是甩卖，傻妞也有自己的一套。

sentences.english: We will have a bargain sale today.
Darling, BeijingMall is having a big sale this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的，这个周末北京商厦大甩卖，你要去吗？

sentences.english: When do you have a big sale?
sentences.chinese: 你们什么时候有大甩卖？

sentences.english: Please come and buy clothes at Huaxing's Great sale!
sentences.chinese: 在华兴大甩卖期间来买衣服吧。

sentences.english: He bought those shorts last year at an end-of-season sale.
sentences.chinese: 他在去年换季大甩卖时买了那些短裤。

sentences.english: We have a clearance sale today.
A midnight madness event starts very late at night.
sentences.chinese: 午夜疯狂大甩卖在深夜开始。

sentences.english: For example, Bed, Bath &Beyond has a clearance section where you can find all kinds of wonderful household items for a fraction of the original cost.
sentences.chinese: 例如，你可以在清仓甩卖点看到各类超值的卫浴寝具。

sentences.english: I bought this top for a very cheap price at a clearance sale.
sentences.chinese: 我是在清仓大甩卖时以相当便宜的价钱买了这件上衣。

sentences.english: Autumn suits new listing, summer on big sale, buy one get free offer.
sentences.chinese: 英语秋装上市，夏装大甩卖，买一送一。

definition: clearance sale/fire sale
to sell cheaply/sacrifice/low price/discount sale
extremely low price/knockdown price
lit. cabbage price/low price
to take an inventory of stock/to clear out one's stock
low price
to sell off/to get rid of in a sale
to sell/to offer for sale/to put on the market
to dump (selling abroad more cheaply than cost price at home)
to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
to convert (an asset) into cash/to cash out
to sell at a loss
to make a loss
to give a discount
to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
to have a sale/sale
